custom_item_118.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Remote Desktop Services -> Remote Desktop Session Host -> Device and Resource Redirection -> 'Do not allow drive redirection' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_119.description: WN12-CC-000039 - Printing over HTTP must be prevented.
custom_item_119.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents the client computer from printing over HTTP, which allows the computer to print to printers on the intranet as well as the Internet.
custom_item_119.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings -> 'Turn off printing over HTTP' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_120.description: WN12-CC-000032 - Downloading print driver packages over HTTP must be prevented.
custom_item_120.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents the computer from downloading print driver packages over HTTP.
custom_item_120.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings -> 'Turn off downloading of print drivers over HTTP' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_121.description: WN12-CC-000047 - Windows must be prevented from using Windows Update to search for drivers.
custom_item_121.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents Windows from searching Windows Update for device drivers when no local drivers for a device are present.
custom_item_121.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings -> 'Turn off Windows Update device driver searching' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_122.description: WN12-UC-000009 - Zone information must be preserved when saving attachments.
custom_item_122.info: Preserving zone of origin (internet, intranet, local, restricted) information on file attachments allows Windows to determine risk.
custom_item_122.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Attachment Manager -> 'Do not preserve zone information in file attachments' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_123.description: WN12-UC-000010 - Mechanisms for removing zone information from file attachments must be hidden.
custom_item_123.info: Preserving zone of origin (internet, intranet, local, restricted) information on file attachments allows Windows to determine risk.  This setting prevents users from manually removing zone information from saved file attachments.
custom_item_123.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Attachment Manager -> 'Hide mechanisms to remove zone information' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_124.description: WN12-UC-000011 - The system must notify antivirus when file attachments are opened.
custom_item_124.info: Attaching malicious files is a known avenue of attack.  This setting configures the system to notify antivirus programs when a user opens a file attachment.
custom_item_124.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Attachment Manager -> 'Notify antivirus programs when opening attachments' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_125.description: WN12-CC-000003 - Windows Peer-to-Peer networking services must be turned off.
custom_item_125.info: Peer-to-Peer applications can allow unauthorized access to a system and exposure of sensitive data.  This setting will turn off the Microsoft Peer-to-Peer Networking Service.
custom_item_125.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Microsoft Peer-to-Peer Networking Services -> 'Turn off Microsoft Peer-to-Peer Networking Services' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_126.description: WN12-CC-000004 - Network Bridges must be prohibited in Windows.
custom_item_126.info: A Network Bridge can connect two or more network segments, allowing unauthorized access or exposure of sensitive data.  This setting prevents a Network Bridge from being installed and configured.
custom_item_126.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Network Connections -> 'Prohibit installation and configuration of Network Bridge on your DNS domain network' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_127.description: WN12-CC-000033 - Event Viewer Events.asp links must be turned off.
custom_item_127.info: Viewing events is a function of administrators, who must not access the internet with privileged accounts.  This setting will disable  Events.asp hyperlinks in Event Viewer to prevent links to the internet from within events.
custom_item_127.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings -> 'Turn off Event Viewer 'Events.asp' links' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_128.description: WN12-CC-000038 - The Internet File Association service must be turned off.
custom_item_128.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents unhandled file associations from using the Microsoft Web service to find an application.
custom_item_128.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings -> 'Turn off Internet File Association service' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_129.description: WN12-CC-000105 - Attachments must be prevented from being downloaded from RSS feeds.
custom_item_129.info: Attachments from RSS feeds may not be secure.  This setting will prevent attachments from being downloaded from RSS feeds.
custom_item_129.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> RSS Feeds -> 'Prevent downloading of enclosures' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_130.description: WN12-CC-000091 - File Explorer shell protocol must run in protected mode.
custom_item_130.info: The shell protocol will  limit the set of folders applications can open when run in protected mode.  Restricting files an application can open to a limited set of folders increases the security of Windows.
custom_item_130.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> File Explorer -> 'Turn off shell protocol protected mode' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_131.description: WN12-CC-000117 - Users must be notified if a web-based program attempts to install software.
custom_item_131.info: Users must be aware of attempted program installations.  This setting ensures users are notified if a web-based program attempts to install software.
custom_item_131.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer -> 'Prevent Internet Explorer security prompt for Windows Installer scripts' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_132.description: WN12-CC-000115 - Users must be prevented from changing installation options.
custom_item_132.info: Installation options for applications are typically controlled by administrators.  This setting prevents users from changing installation options that may bypass security features.
custom_item_132.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer -> 'Allow user control over installs' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_133.description: WN12-CC-000118 - Nonadministrators must be prevented from applying vendor-signed updates.
custom_item_133.info: Uncontrolled system updates can introduce issues to a system.  This setting will prevent users from applying vendor-signed updates (though they may be from a trusted source).
custom_item_133.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer -> 'Prohibit non-administrators from applying vendor signed updates' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_134.description: WN12-CC-000121 - Users must not be presented with Privacy and Installation options on first use of Windows Media Player.
custom_item_134.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents users from being presented with Privacy and Installation options on first use of Windows Media Player, which could enable some communication with the vendor.
custom_item_134.solution: If Windows Media Player is installed, configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Media Player -> 'Do Not Show First Use Dialog Boxes' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_148.description: WN12-CC-000013 - The Windows Connect Now wizards must be disabled.
custom_item_148.info: Windows Connect Now provides wizards for tasks such as 'Set up a wireless router or access point' and must not be available to users.  Functions such as these may allow unauthorized connections to a system and the potential for sensitive information to be compromised.
custom_item_148.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Windows Connect Now -> 'Prohibit access of the Windows Connect Now wizards' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_149.description: WN12-CC-000019 - Remote access to the Plug and Play interface must be disabled for device installation.
custom_item_149.info: Remote access to the Plug and Play interface could potentially allow connections by unauthorized devices.  This setting configures remote access to the Plug and Play interface and must be disabled.
custom_item_149.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation -> 'Allow remote access to the Plug and Play interface' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_150.description: WN12-CC-000021 - A system restore point must be created when a new device driver is installed.
custom_item_150.info: A system restore point allows a rollback if an issue is  encountered when a new device driver is installed.
custom_item_150.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation -> 'Prevent creation of a system restore point during device activity that would normally prompt creation of a restore point' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_151.description: WN12-CC-000020 - An Error Report must not be sent when a generic device driver is installed.
custom_item_151.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents an error report from being sent when a generic device driver is installed.
custom_item_151.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation -> 'Do not send a Windows error report when a generic driver is installed on a device' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_152.description: WN12-CC-000026 - Users must not be prompted to search Windows Update for device drivers.
custom_item_152.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents users from being prompted to search Windows Update for device drivers.
custom_item_152.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Driver Installation -> 'Turn off Windows Update device driver search prompt' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_153.description: WN12-CC-000035 - Errors in handwriting recognition on tablet PCs must not be reported to Microsoft.
custom_item_153.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents errors in handwriting recognition on tablet PCs from being reported to Microsoft.
custom_item_153.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication settings -> 'Turn off handwriting recognition error reporting' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_154.description: WN12-CC-000054 - Users must be prompted to authenticate on resume from sleep (on battery).
custom_item_154.info: Authentication must always be required when accessing a system.  This setting ensures the user is prompted for a password on resume from sleep (on battery).
custom_item_154.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Power Management -> Sleep Settings -> 'Require a password when a computer wakes (on battery)' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_155.description: WN12-CC-000055 - The user must be prompted to authenticate on resume from sleep (plugged in).
custom_item_155.info: Authentication must always be required when accessing a system.  This setting ensures the user is prompted for a password on resume from sleep (plugged in).
custom_item_155.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Power Management -> Sleep Settings -> 'Require a password when a computer wakes (plugged in)' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_156.description: WN12-CC-000062 - Remote Assistance log files must be generated.
custom_item_156.info: Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  This setting will turn on session logging for Remote Assistance connections.
custom_item_156.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Remote Assistance -> 'Turn on session logging' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_157.description: WN12-CC-000090 - Turning off File Explorer heap termination on corruption must be disabled.
custom_item_157.info: Legacy plug-in applications may continue to function when a File Explorer session has become corrupt.  Disabling this feature will prevent this.
custom_item_157.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> File Explorer -> 'Turn off heap termination on corruption' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_158.description: WN12-CC-000120 - Windows Media Digital Rights Management (DRM) must be prevented from accessing the Internet.
custom_item_158.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This check verifies that Windows Media DRM will be prevented from accessing the Internet.
custom_item_158.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Media Digital Rights Management -> 'Prevent Windows Media DRM Internet Access' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_159.description: WN12-UC-000012 - Users must be prevented from sharing files in their profiles.
custom_item_159.info: Allowing users to share files in their profiles may provide unauthorized access or result in the exposure of sensitive data.
custom_item_159.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Network Sharing -> 'Prevent users from sharing files within their profile' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_160.description: WN12-GE-000020 - Software certificate installation files must be removed from Windows 2012/2012 R2.
custom_item_160.info:
Use of software certificates and their accompanying installation files for end users to access resources is less secure than the use of hardware-based certificates.

NOTE: Nessus has provided the target output to assist in reviewing the benchmark to ensure target compliance.
custom_item_160.solution:
Remove any certificate installation files (*.p12 and *.pfx) found on a system.

This does not apply to server-based applications that have a requirement for certificate files, Adobe PreFlight certificate files, or non-certificate installation files with the same extension.
custom_item_160.powershell_args: $drives = (Get-WMIObject Win32_LogicalDisk -filter 'DriveType = 3' | Select-Object DeviceID); $output = ($drives | ForEach-Object { $search = 'dir {0}\*.p12 {0}\*.pfx /s /b' -f $_.DeviceID; cmd /c $search 2>$null }); if ([string]::IsNullOrEmpty($output)) { 'No certificate files found' } else { $output };

custom_item_161.description: WN12-SO-000086 - UIAccess applications must not be allowed to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop.
custom_item_161.info: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized.  This setting prevents User Interface Accessibility programs from disabling the secure desktop for elevation prompts.
custom_item_161.solution:
UAC requirements are NA on Server Core installations.

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control: Allow UIAccess applications to prompt for elevation without using the secure desktop' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_162.description: WN12-CC-000132 - Users must be prevented from mapping local COM ports and redirecting data from the Remote Desktop Session Host to local COM ports.  (Remote Desktop Services Role).
custom_item_162.info: Preventing the redirection of Remote Desktop session data to a client computer's COM ports helps reduce possible exposure of sensitive data.
custom_item_162.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Remote Desktop Services -> Remote Desktop Session Host -> Device and Resource Redirection -> 'Do not allow COM port redirection' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_163.description: WN12-CC-000133 - Users must be prevented from mapping local LPT ports and redirecting data from the Remote Desktop Session Host to local LPT ports.  (Remote Desktop Services Role).
custom_item_163.info: Preventing the redirection of Remote Desktop session data to a client computer's LPT ports helps reduce possible exposure of sensitive data.
custom_item_163.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Remote Desktop Services -> Remote Desktop Session Host -> Device and Resource Redirection -> 'Do not allow LPT port redirection' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_164.description: WN12-CC-000135 - Users must be prevented from redirecting Plug and Play devices to the Remote Desktop Session Host.  (Remote Desktop Services Role).
custom_item_164.info: Preventing the redirection of Plug and Play devices in Remote Desktop sessions helps reduce possible exposure of sensitive data.
custom_item_164.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Remote Desktop Services -> Remote Desktop Session Host -> Device and Resource Redirection -> 'Do not allow supported Plug and Play device redirection' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_165.description: WN12-CC-000134 - The system must be configured to ensure smart card devices can be redirected to the Remote Desktop session.  (Remote Desktop Services Role).
custom_item_165.info: Enabling the redirection of smart card devices allows their use within Remote Desktop sessions.
custom_item_165.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Remote Desktop Services -> Remote Desktop Session Host -> Device and Resource Redirection -> 'Do not allow smart card device redirection' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_166.description: WN12-SO-000081 - Windows must elevate all applications in User Account Control, not just signed ones.
custom_item_166.info: User Account Control (UAC) is a security mechanism for limiting the elevation of privileges, including administrative accounts, unless authorized.  This setting configures whether Windows elevates all applications, or only signed ones.
custom_item_166.solution:
UAC requirements are NA on Server Core installations.

Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'User Account Control: Only elevate executables that are signed and validated' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_167.description: WN12-CC-000045 - The Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program must be disabled.
custom_item_167.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting ensures the Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program is disabled so information is not passed to the vendor.
custom_item_167.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication Settings -> 'Turn off Windows Customer Experience Improvement Program' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_168.description: WN12-UC-000007 - The Windows Help Experience Improvement Program must be disabled.
custom_item_168.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting ensures the Windows Help Experience Improvement Program is disabled to prevent information from being passed to the vendor.
custom_item_168.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication Settings -> 'Turn off Help Experience Improvement Program' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_169.description: WN12-UC-000008 - Windows Help Ratings feedback must be turned off.
custom_item_169.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting ensures users cannot provide ratings feedback to Microsoft for Help content.
custom_item_169.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Internet Communication Management -> Internet Communication Settings -> 'Turn off Help Ratings' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_170.description: WN12-UR-000016 - The Debug programs user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_170.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Debug programs' user right can attach a debugger to any process or to the kernel, providing complete access to sensitive and critical operating system components.  This right is given to Administrators in the default configuration.
custom_item_170.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Debug programs' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_171.description: WN12-SO-000035 - The service principal name (SPN) target name validation level must be turned off.
custom_item_171.info: If a service principle name (SPN) is provided by the client, it is validated against the server's list of SPNs.  Implementation may disrupt file and print sharing capabilities.
custom_item_171.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Microsoft network server: Server SPN target name validation level' to 'Off'.

custom_item_172.description: WN12-SO-000061 - Services using Local System that use Negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication must use the computer identity vs. authenticating anonymously.
custom_item_172.info: Services using Local System that use Negotiate when reverting to NTLM authentication may gain unauthorized access if allowed to authenticate anonymously vs. using the computer identity.
custom_item_172.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Network security: Allow Local System to use computer identity for NTLM' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_173.description: WN12-SO-000062 - NTLM must be prevented from falling back to a Null session.
custom_item_173.info: NTLM sessions that are allowed to fall back to Null (unauthenticated) sessions may gain unauthorized access.
custom_item_173.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Network security: Allow LocalSystem NULL session fallback' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_174.description: WN12-SO-000063 - PKU2U authentication using online identities must be prevented.
custom_item_174.info: PKU2U is a peer-to-peer authentication protocol.   This setting prevents online identities from authenticating to domain-joined systems.  Authentication will be centrally managed with Windows user accounts.
custom_item_174.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Network security: Allow PKU2U authentication requests to this computer to use online identities' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_175.description: WN12-SO-000064 - Kerberos encryption types must be configured to prevent the use of DES and RC4 encryption suites.
custom_item_175.info:
Certain encryption types are no longer considered secure. The DES and RC4 encryption suites must not be used for Kerberos encryption.

Note: Removing the previously allowed RC4_HMAC_MD5 encryption suite may have operational impacts and must be thoroughly tested for the environment before changing. This includes but is not limited to parent\child trusts where RC4 is still enabled; selecting 'The other domain supports Kerberos AES Encryption' may be required on the domain trusts to allow client communication across the trust relationship.
custom_item_175.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> 'Network security: Configure encryption types allowed for Kerberos' to 'Enabled' with only the following selected:

AES128_HMAC_SHA1
AES256_HMAC_SHA1
Future encryption types

Note: Removing the previously allowed RC4_HMAC_MD5 encryption suite may have operational impacts and must be thoroughly tested for the environment before changing. This includes but is not limited to parent\child trusts where RC4 is still enabled; selecting 'The other domain supports Kerberos AES Encryption' may be required on the domain trusts to allow client communication across the trust relationship.

custom_item_176.description: WN12-SO-000037 - IPv6 source routing must be configured to the highest protection level.
custom_item_176.info: Configuring the system to disable IPv6 source routing protects against spoofing.
custom_item_176.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'MSS: (DisableIPSourceRouting IPv6) IP source routing protection level (protects against packet spoofing)' to 'Highest protection, source routing is completely disabled'.

(See 'Updating the Windows Security Options File' in the STIG Overview document if MSS settings are not visible in the system's policy tools.)

custom_item_177.description: WN12-SO-000047 - IPv6 TCP data retransmissions must be configured to prevent resources from becoming exhausted.
custom_item_177.info: Configuring Windows to limit the number of times that IPv6 TCP retransmits unacknowledged data segments before aborting the attempt helps prevent resources from becoming exhausted.
custom_item_177.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> Security Options >> 'MSS: (TcpMaxDataRetransmissions IPv6) How many times unacknowledged data is retransmitted (3 recommended, 5 is default)' to '3' or less.

(See 'Updating the Windows Security Options File' in the STIG Overview document if MSS settings are not visible in the system's policy tools.)

custom_item_178.description: WN12-CC-000005 - Domain users must be required to elevate when setting a networks location.
custom_item_178.info: Selecting an incorrect network location may allow greater exposure of a system.  Elevation is required by default on nondomain systems to change network location.  This setting configures elevation to also be required on domain-joined systems.
custom_item_178.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Network Connections -> 'Require domain users to elevate when setting a network's location' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_179.description: WN12-CC-000006 - All Direct Access traffic must be routed through the internal network.
custom_item_179.info: Routing all Direct Access  traffic through the internal network allows monitoring and prevents split tunneling.
custom_item_179.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Network -> Network Connections -> 'Route all traffic through the internal network' to 'Enabled: Enabled State'.

custom_item_180.description: WN12-CC-000016 - Windows Update must be prevented from searching for point and print drivers.
custom_item_180.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting will prevent Windows from searching Windows Update for point and print drivers.  Only the local driver store and server driver cache will be searched.
custom_item_180.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Printers -> 'Extend Point and Print connection to search Windows Update' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_181.description: WN12-CC-000022 - Device metadata retrieval from the Internet must be prevented.
custom_item_181.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting will prevent Windows from retrieving device metadata from the Internet.
custom_item_181.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> System >> Device Installation >> 'Prevent device metadata retrieval from the Internet' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_182.description: WN12-CC-000024 - Device driver searches using Windows Update must be prevented.
custom_item_182.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting will prevent the system from searching Windows Update for device drivers.
custom_item_182.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation -> 'Specify search order for device driver source locations' to 'Enabled: Do not search Windows Update'.

custom_item_183.description: WN12-CC-000066 - Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool (MSDT) interactive communication with Microsoft must be prevented.
custom_item_183.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents the MSDT from communicating with and sending collected data to Microsoft, the default support provider.
custom_item_183.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Troubleshooting and Diagnostics -> Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool -> 'Microsoft Support Diagnostic Tool: Turn on MSDT interactive communication with support provider' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_184.description: WN12-CC-000067 - Access to Windows Online Troubleshooting Service (WOTS) must be prevented.
custom_item_184.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents users from searching troubleshooting content on Microsoft servers.  Only local content will be available.
custom_item_184.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Troubleshooting and Diagnostics -> Scripted Diagnostics -> 'Troubleshooting: Allow users to access online troubleshooting content on Microsoft servers from the Troubleshooting Control Panel (via the Windows Online Troubleshooting Service - WOTS)' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_185.description: WN12-CC-000068 - Responsiveness events must be prevented from being aggregated and sent to Microsoft.
custom_item_185.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting prevents responsiveness events from being aggregated and sent to Microsoft.
custom_item_185.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Troubleshooting and Diagnostics -> Windows Performance PerfTrack -> 'Enable/Disable PerfTrack' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_186.description: WN12-CC-000071 - The Application Compatibility Program Inventory must be prevented from collecting data and sending the information to Microsoft.
custom_item_186.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting will prevent the Program Inventory from collecting data about a system and sending the information to Microsoft.
custom_item_186.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Application Compatibility -> 'Turn off Inventory Collector' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_187.description: WN12-CC-000072 - Autoplay must be turned off for non-volume devices.
custom_item_187.info: Allowing Autoplay to execute may introduce malicious code to a system.  Autoplay begins reading from a drive as soon as media is inserted into the drive.  As a result, the setup file of programs or music on audio media may start.  This setting will disable Autoplay for non-volume devices (such as Media Transfer Protocol (MTP) devices).
custom_item_187.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> AutoPlay Policies -> 'Disallow Autoplay for non-volume devices' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_188.description: WN12-CC-000089 - Explorer Data Execution Prevention must be enabled.
custom_item_188.info: Data Execution Prevention (DEP) provides additional protection by performing  checks on memory to help prevent malicious code from running.  This setting will prevent Data Execution Prevention from being turned off for File Explorer.
custom_item_188.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> File Explorer -> 'Turn off Data Execution Prevention for Explorer' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_189.description: WN12-CC-000073 - The default Autorun behavior must be configured to prevent Autorun commands.
custom_item_189.info: Allowing Autorun commands to execute may introduce malicious code to a system.  Configuring this setting prevents Autorun commands from executing.
custom_item_189.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> AutoPlay Policies -> 'Set the default behavior for AutoRun' to 'Enabled:Do not execute any autorun commands'.

custom_item_190.description: WN12-RG-000001 - Standard user accounts must only have Read permissions to the Winlogon registry key.
custom_item_190.info: Permissions on the Winlogon registry key must only allow privileged accounts to change registry values.  If standard users have these permissions, there is a potential for programs to run with elevated privileges when a privileged user logs on to the system.

custom_item_191.description: WN12-SO-000051 - Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts must not be allowed.
custom_item_191.info: Anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts allows anonymous log on users (null session connections) to list all accounts names, thus providing a list of potential points to attack the system.
custom_item_191.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Local Policies -> Security Options -> 'Network access: Do not allow anonymous enumeration of SAM accounts' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_192.description: WN12-UR-000001 - The Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
custom_item_192.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller' user right may be able to retrieve the credentials of other accounts from Credential Manager.
custom_item_192.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Access Credential Manager as a trusted caller' to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

custom_item_193.description: WN12-UR-000005 - The Allow log on locally user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_193.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Allow log on locally' user right can log on interactively to a system.
custom_item_193.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Allow log on locally' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_194.description: WN12-UR-000006-DC - The Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_194.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services' user right can access a system through Remote Desktop.
custom_item_194.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Allow log on through Remote Desktop Services' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_195.description: WN12-UR-000007 - The Back up files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_195.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Back up files and directories' user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data.
custom_item_195.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Back up files and directories' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_196.description: WN12-UR-000011 - The Create a pagefile user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_196.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Create a pagefile' user right can change the size of a pagefile, which could affect system performance.
custom_item_196.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Create a pagefile' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_197.description: WN12-UR-000012 - The Create a token object user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
custom_item_197.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

The 'Create a token object' user right allows a process to create an access token. This could be used to provide elevated rights and compromise a system.
custom_item_197.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Create a token object' to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

custom_item_198.description: WN12-UR-000013 - The Create global objects user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.
custom_item_198.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Create global objects' user right can create objects that are available to all sessions, which could affect processes in other users' sessions.
custom_item_198.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Create global objects' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators
Service
Local Service
Network Service

custom_item_199.description: WN12-UR-000014 - The Create permanent shared objects user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
custom_item_199.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Create permanent shared objects' user right could expose sensitive data by creating shared objects.
custom_item_199.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Create permanent shared objects' to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

custom_item_200.description: WN12-UR-000015 - The Create symbolic links user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_200.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Create symbolic links' user right can create pointers to other objects, which could potentially expose the system to attack.
custom_item_200.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Create symbolic links' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

Systems that have the Hyper-V role will also have 'Virtual Machines' given this user right.  If this needs to be added manually, enter it as 'NT Virtual Machine\Virtual Machines'.

custom_item_201.description: WN12-UR-000023 - The Force shutdown from a remote system user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_201.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Force shutdown from a remote system' user right can remotely shut down a system, which could result in a DoS.
custom_item_201.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Force shutdown from a remote system' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_202.description: WN12-UR-000024 - The Generate security audits user right must only be assigned to Local Service and Network Service.
custom_item_202.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

The 'Generate security audits' user right specifies users and processes that can generate Security Log audit records, which must only be the system service accounts defined.
custom_item_202.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Generate security audits' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Local Service
Network Service

custom_item_203.description: WN12-UR-000025 - The Impersonate a client after authentication user right must only be assigned to Administrators, Service, Local Service, and Network Service.
custom_item_203.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

The 'Impersonate a client after authentication' user right allows a program to impersonate another user or account to run on their behalf.  An attacker could potentially use this to elevate privileges.
custom_item_203.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Impersonate a client after authentication' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators
Service
Local Service
Network Service

custom_item_204.description: WN12-UR-000027 - The Increase scheduling priority user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_204.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Increase scheduling priority' user right can change a scheduling priority causing performance issues or a DoS.
custom_item_204.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Increase scheduling priority' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_205.description: WN12-UR-000028 - The Load and unload device drivers user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_205.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

The 'Load and unload device drivers' user right allows device drivers to dynamically be loaded on a system by a user.  This could potentially be used to install malicious code by an attacker.
custom_item_205.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Load and unload device drivers' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_206.description: WN12-UR-000029 - The Lock pages in memory user right must not be assigned to any groups or accounts.
custom_item_206.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

The 'Lock pages in memory' user right allows physical memory to be assigned to processes, which could cause performance issues or a DoS.
custom_item_206.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Lock pages in memory' to be defined but containing no entries (blank).

custom_item_207.description: WN12-UR-000032 - The Manage auditing and security log user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_207.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Manage auditing and security log' user right can manage the security log and change auditing configurations.  This could be used to clear evidence of tampering.
custom_item_207.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Manage auditing and security log' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_208.description: WN12-UR-000034 - The Modify firmware environment values user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_208.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Modify firmware environment values' user right can change hardware configuration environment variables.  This could result in hardware failures or a DoS.
custom_item_208.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Modify firmware environment values' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_209.description: WN12-UR-000035 - The Perform volume maintenance tasks user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_209.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Perform volume maintenance tasks' user right can manage volume and disk configurations.  They could potentially delete volumes, resulting in data loss or a DoS.
custom_item_209.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Perform volume maintenance tasks' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_210.description: WN12-UR-000036 - The Profile single process user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_210.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Profile single process' user right can monitor nonsystem processes performance.  An attacker could potentially use this to identify processes to attack.
custom_item_210.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Profile single process' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_211.description: WN12-UR-000040 - The Restore files and directories user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_211.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Restore files and directories' user right can circumvent file and directory permissions and could allow access to sensitive data.  It could also be used to overwrite more current data.
custom_item_211.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Restore files and directories' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_212.description: WN12-UR-000042 - The Take ownership of files or other objects user right must only be assigned to the Administrators group.
custom_item_212.info:
Inappropriate granting of user rights can provide system, administrative, and other high-level capabilities.

Accounts with the 'Take ownership of files or other objects' user right can take ownership of objects and make changes.
custom_item_212.solution:
Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Local Policies >> User Rights Assignment >> 'Take ownership of files or other objects' to only include the following accounts or groups:

Administrators

custom_item_213.description: WN12-AU-000001 - The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation successes.
custom_item_213.info:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Credential validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon.
custom_item_213.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> Account Logon -> 'Audit Credential Validation' with 'Success' selected.

custom_item_214.description: WN12-AU-000002 - The system must be configured to audit Account Logon - Credential Validation failures.
custom_item_214.info:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Credential validation records events related to validation tests on credentials for a user account logon.
custom_item_214.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> Account Logon -> 'Audit Credential Validation' with 'Failure' selected.

custom_item_215.description: WN12-AU-000011-DC - Windows Server 2012/2012 R2 domain controllers must be configured to audit Account Management - Computer Account Management successes.

Computer Account Management records events such as creating, changing, deleting, renaming, disabling, or enabling computer accounts.

custom_item_221.description: WN12-AU-000045 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Logoff successes.

custom_item_224.description: WN12-AU-000053 - The system must be configured to audit Logon/Logoff - Special Logon successes.
custom_item_224.info:
Maintaining an audit trail of system activity logs can help identify configuration errors, troubleshoot service disruptions, and analyze compromises that have occurred, as well as detect attacks.  Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Special Logon records special logons which have administrative privileges and can be used to elevate processes.
custom_item_224.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Windows Settings -> Security Settings -> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration -> System Audit Policies -> Logon/Logoff -> 'Audit Special Logon' with 'Success' selected.

custom_item_236.description: WN12-CC-000084 - The Application event log size must be configured to 32768 KB or greater.
custom_item_236.info: Inadequate log size will cause the log to fill up quickly. This may prevent audit events from being recorded properly and require frequent attention by administrative personnel.
custom_item_236.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Administrative Templates >> Windows Components >> Event Log Service >> Application >> 'Specify the maximum log file size (KB)' to 'Enabled' with a 'Maximum Log Size (KB)' of '32768' or greater.

custom_item_240.description: WN12-SV-000100 - The Fax service must be disabled if installed.
custom_item_240.info: Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
custom_item_240.solution: Remove or disable the Fax (fax) service.

custom_item_241.description: WN12-SV-000101 - The Microsoft FTP service must not be installed unless required.
custom_item_241.info: Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
custom_item_241.solution:
Remove or disable the 'Microsoft FTP Service' (Service name: FTPSVC).

To remove the 'FTP Server' role from a system:
Start 'Server Manager'
Select the server with the 'FTP Server' role.
Scroll down to 'ROLES AND FEATURES' in the left pane.
Select 'Remove Roles and Features' from the drop down 'TASKS' list.
Select the appropriate server on the 'Server Selection' page, click 'Next'.
De-select 'FTP Server' under 'Web Server (IIS).
Click 'Next' and 'Remove' as prompted.

custom_item_242.description: WN12-SV-000103 - The Peer Networking Identity Manager service must be disabled if installed.
custom_item_242.info: Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
custom_item_242.solution: Remove or disable the Peer Networking Identity Manager (p2pimsvc) service.

custom_item_243.description: WN12-SV-000104 - The Simple TCP/IP Services service must be disabled if installed.
custom_item_243.info: Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
custom_item_243.solution: Remove or disable the Simple TCP/IP Services (simptcp) service.

custom_item_244.description: WN12-SV-000105 - The Telnet service must be disabled if installed.
custom_item_244.info: Unnecessary services increase the attack surface of a system. Some of these services may not support required levels of authentication or encryption.
custom_item_244.solution: Remove or disable the Telnet (tlntsvr) service.

custom_item_245.description: WN12-CC-000023 - Windows must be prevented from sending an error report when a device driver requests additional software during installation.
custom_item_245.info:
Some features may communicate with the vendor, sending system information or downloading data or components for the feature.  Turning off this capability will prevent potentially sensitive information from being sent outside the enterprise and uncontrolled updates to the system.
This setting will prevent Windows from sending an error report to Microsoft when a device driver requests additional software during installation.
custom_item_245.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> System -> Device Installation -> 'Prevent Windows from sending an error report when a device driver requests additional software during installation' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_250.description: WN12-PK-000003 - The DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed into the Untrusted Certificates Store on unclassified systems.
custom_item_250.info: To ensure users do not experience denial of service when performing certificate-based authentication to DoD websites due to the system chaining to a root other than DoD Root CAs, the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates must be installed in the Untrusted Certificate Store. This requirement only applies to unclassified systems.
custom_item_250.solution:
Install the DoD Interoperability Root CA cross-certificates on unclassified systems.

Issued To - Issued By - Thumbprint
DoD Root CA 3 - DoD Interoperability Root CA 2 - 49CBE933151872E17C8EAE7F0ABA97FB610F6477

The certificates can be installed using the InstallRoot tool. The tool and user guide are available on Cyber Exchange at https://cyber.mil/pki-pke/tools-configuration-files. PKI can be found at https://crl.gds.disa.mil/.
custom_item_250.powershell_args: $res = Get-ChildItem cert:\LocalMachine\Disallowed | Where-Object {$_.Thumbprint -like '49CBE933151872E17C8EAE7F0ABA97FB610F6477' -AND $_.Issuer -like '*DoD Interoperability*'} | Format-List -Property *; If ($res) { $res } Else { 'No matching certificates found' }

custom_item_251.description: WN12-RG-000002 - Standard user accounts must only have Read permissions to the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key.
custom_item_251.info: Permissions on the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key must only allow privileged accounts to add or change registry values.  If standard user accounts have these permissions, there is a potential for programs to run with elevated privileges when a privileged user logs on to the system.

custom_item_252.description: WN12-RG-000002 - Standard user accounts must only have Read permissions to the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key - compatability
custom_item_252.info: Permissions on the Active Setup\Installed Components registry key must only allow privileged accounts to add or change registry values.  If standard user accounts have these permissions, there is a potential for programs to run with elevated privileges when a privileged user logs on to the system.

custom_item_253.description: WN12-CC-000116 - The Windows Installer Always install with elevated privileges option must be disabled.
custom_item_253.info: Standard user accounts must not be granted elevated privileges.  Enabling Windows Installer to elevate privileges when installing applications can allow malicious persons and applications to gain full control of a system.
custom_item_253.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Windows Components -> Windows Installer -> 'Always install with elevated privileges' to 'Disabled'.

custom_item_254.description: WN12-UC-000001 - A screen saver must be enabled on the system.
custom_item_254.info: Unattended systems are susceptible to unauthorized use and must be locked when unattended.  Enabling a password-protected screen saver to engage after a specified period of time helps protects critical and sensitive data from exposure to unauthorized personnel with physical access to the computer.
custom_item_254.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Control Panel -> Personalization -> 'Enable screen saver' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_255.description: WN12-UC-000003 - The screen saver must be password protected.
custom_item_255.info: Unattended systems are susceptible to unauthorized use and must be locked when unattended.  Enabling a password-protected screen saver to engage after a specified period of time helps protects critical and sensitive data from exposure to unauthorized personnel with physical access to the computer.
custom_item_255.solution: Configure the policy value for User Configuration -> Administrative Templates -> Control Panel -> Personalization -> 'Password protect the screen saver' to 'Enabled'.

custom_item_256.info:

Audit logs are necessary to provide a trail of evidence in case the system or network is compromised.  Collecting this data is essential for analyzing the security of information assets and detecting signs of suspicious and unexpected behavior.

Removable Storage auditing under Object Access records events related to access attempts on file system objects on removable storage devices.
custom_item_256.solution: Configure the policy value for Computer Configuration >> Windows Settings >> Security Settings >> Advanced Audit Policy Configuration >> System Audit Policies >> Object Access >> 'Audit Removable Storage' with 'Failure' selected.
